    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    BattleSystem
    The BattleSystem class manages turn-based combat between the player and enemies.
    Character
    The Character class represents a generic character in the game.
    ChestHandler
    The ChestHandler class manages player interaction with chests and validates riddle answers before allowing access to rewards.
    Enemy
    The Enemy class represents a hostile character in the game.
    GambleGame
    The GambleGame class represents a gambling mini-game where the player can wager potions for a chance to win more.
    GameMenus
    The GameMenus class handles all menu-related user interactions including the start menu, help menu, and introductory narration.
    Goblin
    The Goblin class represents a basic enemy type in the game.
    GridQuestRPG
    The GridQuestRPG class is the main driver of the game.
    Inventory
    The Inventory class manages all items owned by the player.
    InventoryMenu
    The InventoryMenu class handles all user interaction related to viewing and managing the player's inventory.
    Player
    The Player class represents the user-controlled character in the game.
    Riddle
    The Riddle class represents a single riddle consisting of a question and its corresponding answer.
    RiddleBank
    The RiddleBank class stores and manages a collection of riddles used throughout the game.
    Room
    The Room class represents a single location in the game world.
    Saveable
    The Saveable interface defines a contract for objects whose data can be saved to a file.
    SaveManager
    The SaveManager class handles saving and loading game data using external files.
    Sentinel
    The Sentinel class represents the boss enemy in the game.
    SentinelBattle
    The SentinelBattle class manages the final boss encounter in the game.
    Utils
    The Utils class provides common utility methods used throughout the game, such as pausing execution, clearing the console, and saving simple data to a file.
    WizardHandler
    Handles all interactions with the wizard character.
    WorldBuilder
    The WorldBuilder class is responsible for creating and initializing the game world and its rooms.
    WorldMap
    The WorldMap class represents a 2-D mini-map of the game world.
